Common GE Dryer Problems and Their Causes
When your GE dryer stops heating, makes unusual noises, or fails to start altogether, laundry day quickly transforms from a routine task into a frustrating ordeal. Wet clothes piling up and disrupted household schedules aren't just inconveniences—they're genuine problems that demand prompt, expert attention.
At Sears Home Services, we understand both the technical complexities of GE dryers and the urgency you feel when these essential appliances malfunction. Our factory-trained technicians bring specialized expertise to diagnose and repair every model in the GE lineup, from basic units to sophisticated models with advanced sensor drying technology and smart features.
Understanding How Your GE Dryer Works
GE dryers combine precision engineering with innovative features designed for reliable performance. At their core, these appliances operate through a coordinated system of heating elements or gas burners, motors, airflow components, and electronic controls.
In electric GE dryers, heating coils convert electrical energy into heat, while gas models use a burner assembly with ignition components to create heat. Both types rely on a motor-driven drum that tumbles clothes while a blower fan circulates heated air through the tumbling garments and then out through the exhaust system.
Many GE dryers feature sophisticated moisture-sensing technology that monitors humidity levels inside the drum and automatically adjusts drying time accordingly. This system uses sensor bars inside the drum that detect moisture levels as clothes tumble against them, communicating this information to the control board.
The control panel, whether using traditional knobs or digital displays, interfaces with an electronic control board that serves as the dryer's command center. This sophisticated component processes information from various sensors and manages all functions from temperature regulation to cycle timing.
Understanding these specialized components helps explain why GE dryers require technical expertise for proper diagnosis and repair. When problems arise, identifying which part of this interconnected system has malfunctioned is crucial for effective solutions.
Common GE Dryer Problems and Their Causes
Heating Issues
"My GE dryer runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources:
Electric Heating Element Failures: The heating coil may have burned out or developed breaks in the element. When functioning correctly, this component should glow red when active and show consistent electrical resistance when tested.
Gas Ignition Problems: In gas models, the igniter may fail to glow properly, or flame sensor issues might prevent the gas valve from opening. You might hear the igniter clicking without the burner igniting, indicating a specific component in the ignition sequence has failed.
Thermostat and Thermal Fuse Failures: GE dryers use multiple temperature-sensing devices as safety features. When these components fail or trip due to overheating, they can prevent the heating system from operating while allowing the drum to continue rotating.
Airflow Restrictions: Even with functioning heating components, restricted airflow from lint buildup in the exhaust system, clogged lint screen, or internal ductwork blockages can trigger safety features that disable heating or significantly reduce drying efficiency.
If your GE dryer isn't producing adequate heat, our clothes dryer repair technicians can diagnose and resolve these heating system problems safely and effectively.
Mechanical and Operation Issues
Several mechanical problems can affect GE dryer performance:
Drum Not Turning: May indicate drive belt failures, motor issues, or broken drum support rollers. You might hear the motor running without drum movement, suggesting a broken or slipped belt.
Start Problems: Failure to start can stem from door switch malfunctions, broken start switches, control board issues, or power supply problems. Often, no response when pressing the start button indicates electrical control issues rather than mechanical failures.
Premature Stopping: Dryers that stop before clothes are dry might have cycling thermostat failures, moisture sensor problems, or electronic control issues. This can manifest as short cycles or sudden shutdowns mid-cycle.
Noisy Operation: Unusual sounds often indicate worn drum support rollers, idler pulleys, or motor bearings that require replacement. Different noises point to specific components—squeaking often indicates roller issues, while rumbling might suggest drum support problems.
When your GE dryer experiences mechanical failures, our GE dryer repair technicians can quickly identify the cause and implement the appropriate repair.
Error Codes and Electronic Problems
Modern GE dryers display specific codes to help identify problems:
E1 Codes: Typically indicate thermistor or temperature sensing failures that affect heating control
E2 Codes: Usually signal user interface or button circuit issues that affect cycle selection
E3 Codes: Often relate to moisture sensor problems that impact automatic cycle termination
E4/E5 Codes: Generally indicate main control board communication or memory failures
E6 Codes: Frequently point to motor or drive system electrical problems
For persistent error codes or electronic malfunctions, professional diagnosis ensures the correct component is identified and replaced.
Vent and Airflow Problems
Proper airflow is critical for GE dryer operation, with several common issues affecting performance:
Lint Screen Blockages: Even partially clogged lint screens can significantly reduce airflow and extend drying times.
Vent Line Restrictions: Crushed, kinked, or lint-clogged vent lines prevent proper air and moisture evacuation, causing extended drying times and potential overheating.
External Vent Hood Obstructions: Lint accumulation, bird nests, or damaged vent covers can restrict exhaust airflow, affecting performance and creating safety hazards.
Internal Duct Blockages: Lint can accumulate in the dryer's internal ductwork, particularly near the blower fan or transition hose, restricting airflow even when external venting appears clear.
These airflow issues not only affect performance but create potential fire hazards when not addressed. Regular dryer duct cleaning is essential for both efficiency and safety.
Try These Steps Before Calling for GE Dryer Repair
Before scheduling professional dryer repair service, several troubleshooting steps might resolve minor issues:
1. Check the Power Supply


Verify the dryer is properly plugged in


Ensure the circuit breaker hasn't tripped (electric models)


Check that the gas supply valve is fully open (gas models)


Test the outlet with another device to confirm power is available


2. Inspect the Lint Filter and Venting


Clean the lint filter thoroughly – wash it with water and a soft-bristle brush


Check the external vent hood while the dryer is running to confirm strong airflow


Inspect the vent duct for crushing, kinking, or disconnection


Clean any accessible portion of the vent line


3. Reset the Electronic Controls


Disconnect power for 1-2 minutes


Restore power and attempt a normal cycle


For models with digital displays, consult your owner's manual for specific reset procedures


4. Verify Proper Operation


Ensure the door closes completely and the door switch engages


Select a timed dry cycle rather than a sensor cycle for testing


Listen for normal sounds during startup and operation


5. Check for Error Codes


Note any error codes or blinking lights on the control panel


Consult your owner's manual for their meaning


Clear the code if instructed and monitor if it returns

To test whether the electrical outlet is the problem, plug a hair dryer or other electrical device into it. If the hair dryer doesn't work, the wiring in the outlet is the problem. Have an electrician repair the electrical outlet.

Loose wiring connections between the electronic control board and the control panel can prevent the washer from powering up.
Unplug the washer from the electrical outlet if it isn’t already unplugged and check the wiring connections between the main electronic control board and the control panel. Reconnect any loose wires. This may fix the washer problem.
A damaged control panel can also prevent the washer from powering up. Replace the control panel if it’s damaged.
8. Have a Service Technician Fix the Washer
Complicated washer problems can be difficult to diagnose and repair on your own. When all else fails, schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and fix the washer.
The repair technician will conduct advanced tests to determine the cause of the washer problem and repair the washer.
Common Causes for More GE Washing Machine Issues
Washers all have some common components such as water valves, drive motors and drain pumps. Because many washing machine components are similar, they can encounter similar part failures.
Here are some of the most common GE washer failures.
Broken Knobs
Control knobs are some of the first components to fail in washers. You use the washer control knobs to set each cycle so they often wear out faster than other components.
You can typically replace broken washer knobs yourself. Order replacement knobs from our Sears PartsDirect website.
Most control knobs just push onto the stem on the control panel. Some knobs are threaded onto the stem. Timer control knobs are sometimes more complicated to replace. To replace some timer knobs, you need to unplug the washer and pry out the timer knob shaft from the back of the timer to release the control knob locking tab and remove the timer knob. Is your Whirlpool washer start button not working?
Faulty Start Switch
The washer start switch is another component that you use constantly on your washer. It can also wear out quicker than other components. When you push the start button but the washer won’t start, you may need to replace the start button.
If you’re unsure whether the start button is bad, have a service technician examine and repair your washing machine.
Broken Washer Motor
Overloading the washer is a common mistake that users make and overloading causes the washer motor to wear out faster. Keep your washer motor lasting longer by following the laundry loading instructions in your owner’s manual. Is your Whirlpool washer not turning on?
When you washer motor does go bad, have a service technician replace it.
Shorted Main Control Board
The main electronic control board, also called the mother board, governs the timing and execution of the washer component functions. It controls the fill valves, the drive motor and the drain pump.
Because it’s connected to so many washer components through wiring, the main control board can experience an electrical short circuit at any time. You’ll usually see burnt wiring connected to the control board or a burn spot on the control board circuitry when it experiences an electrical short.
Replace the main electronic control board when it shorts out. Also check the circuit connected to the control board or have a service technician check the circuits before you install the new main control board so the new board doesn’t short out again as soon as you power up the washer.
Call Sears Home Services for Assistance from Expert GE Washer Repairmen
We’re your best option for quick and easy local washer repair and maintenance of front loading, top-load and portable washing machines. Whether your washing machine is leaking, your washer won’t fill with water, or your washing machine smells bad, you can count on Sears Home Services for the best washer service technicians in the business. Our technicians are local, licensed and vetted, with the skills to get fix a broken washer.
When your washing machine needs repair, schedule a repair appointment online. Same-day and next-day service appointments are available in many areas.
Trust Sears Home Services to fix your GE washer fast.
Common GE Dryer Problems and Their Causes
When your GE dryer stops heating, makes unusual noises, or fails to start altogether, laundry day quickly transforms from a routine task into a frustrating ordeal. Wet clothes piling up and disrupted household schedules aren't just inconveniences—they're genuine problems that demand prompt, expert attention.
At Sears Home Services, we understand both the technical complexities of GE dryers and the urgency you feel when these essential appliances malfunction. Our factory-trained technicians bring specialized expertise to diagnose and repair every model in the GE lineup, from basic units to sophisticated models with advanced sensor drying technology and smart features.
Understanding How Your GE Dryer Works
GE dryers combine precision engineering with innovative features designed for reliable performance. At their core, these appliances operate through a coordinated system of heating elements or gas burners, motors, airflow components, and electronic controls.
In electric GE dryers, heating coils convert electrical energy into heat, while gas models use a burner assembly with ignition components to create heat. Both types rely on a motor-driven drum that tumbles clothes while a blower fan circulates heated air through the tumbling garments and then out through the exhaust system.
Many GE dryers feature sophisticated moisture-sensing technology that monitors humidity levels inside the drum and automatically adjusts drying time accordingly. This system uses sensor bars inside the drum that detect moisture levels as clothes tumble against them, communicating this information to the control board.
The control panel, whether using traditional knobs or digital displays, interfaces with an electronic control board that serves as the dryer's command center. This sophisticated component processes information from various sensors and manages all functions from temperature regulation to cycle timing.
Understanding these specialized components helps explain why GE dryers require technical expertise for proper diagnosis and repair. When problems arise, identifying which part of this interconnected system has malfunctioned is crucial for effective solutions.
Common GE Dryer Problems and Their Causes
Heating Issues
"My GE dryer runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources:
Electric Heating Element Failures: The heating coil may have burned out or developed breaks in the element. When functioning correctly, this component should glow red when active and show consistent electrical resistance when tested.
Gas Ignition Problems: In gas models, the igniter may fail to glow properly, or flame sensor issues might prevent the gas valve from opening. You might hear the igniter clicking without the burner igniting, indicating a specific component in the ignition sequence has failed.
Thermostat and Thermal Fuse Failures: GE dryers use multiple temperature-sensing devices as safety features. When these components fail or trip due to overheating, they can prevent the heating system from operating while allowing the drum to continue rotating.
Airflow Restrictions: Even with functioning heating components, restricted airflow from lint buildup in the exhaust system, clogged lint screen, or internal ductwork blockages can trigger safety features that disable heating or significantly reduce drying efficiency.
If your GE dryer isn't producing adequate heat, our clothes dryer repair technicians can diagnose and resolve these heating system problems safely and effectively.
Mechanical and Operation Issues
Several mechanical problems can affect GE dryer performance:
Drum Not Turning: May indicate drive belt failures, motor issues, or broken drum support rollers. You might hear the motor running without drum movement, suggesting a broken or slipped belt.
Start Problems: Failure to start can stem from door switch malfunctions, broken start switches, control board issues, or power supply problems. Often, no response when pressing the start button indicates electrical control issues rather than mechanical failures.
Premature Stopping: Dryers that stop before clothes are dry might have cycling thermostat failures, moisture sensor problems, or electronic control issues. This can manifest as short cycles or sudden shutdowns mid-cycle.
Noisy Operation: Unusual sounds often indicate worn drum support rollers, idler pulleys, or motor bearings that require replacement. Different noises point to specific components—squeaking often indicates roller issues, while rumbling might suggest drum support problems.
When your GE dryer experiences mechanical failures, our GE dryer repair technicians can quickly identify the cause and implement the appropriate repair.
Error Codes and Electronic Problems
Modern GE dryers display specific codes to help identify problems:
E1 Codes: Typically indicate thermistor or temperature sensing failures that affect heating control
E2 Codes: Usually signal user interface or button circuit issues that affect cycle selection
E3 Codes: Often relate to moisture sensor problems that impact automatic cycle termination
E4/E5 Codes: Generally indicate main control board communication or memory failures
E6 Codes: Frequently point to motor or drive system electrical problems
For persistent error codes or electronic malfunctions, professional diagnosis ensures the correct component is identified and replaced.
Vent and Airflow Problems
Proper airflow is critical for GE dryer operation, with several common issues affecting performance:
Lint Screen Blockages: Even partially clogged lint screens can significantly reduce airflow and extend drying times.
Vent Line Restrictions: Crushed, kinked, or lint-clogged vent lines prevent proper air and moisture evacuation, causing extended drying times and potential overheating.
External Vent Hood Obstructions: Lint accumulation, bird nests, or damaged vent covers can restrict exhaust airflow, affecting performance and creating safety hazards.
Internal Duct Blockages: Lint can accumulate in the dryer's internal ductwork, particularly near the blower fan or transition hose, restricting airflow even when external venting appears clear.
These airflow issues not only affect performance but create potential fire hazards when not addressed. Regular dryer duct cleaning is essential for both efficiency and safety.
Try These Steps Before Calling for GE Dryer Repair
Before scheduling professional dryer repair service, several troubleshooting steps might resolve minor issues:
1. Check the Power Supply


Verify the dryer is properly plugged in


Ensure the circuit breaker hasn't tripped (electric models)


Check that the gas supply valve is fully open (gas models)


Test the outlet with another device to confirm power is available


2. Inspect the Lint Filter and Venting


Clean the lint filter thoroughly – wash it with water and a soft-bristle brush


Check the external vent hood while the dryer is running to confirm strong airflow


Inspect the vent duct for crushing, kinking, or disconnection


Clean any accessible portion of the vent line


3. Reset the Electronic Controls


Disconnect power for 1-2 minutes


Restore power and attempt a normal cycle


For models with digital displays, consult your owner's manual for specific reset procedures


4. Verify Proper Operation


Ensure the door closes completely and the door switch engages


Select a timed dry cycle rather than a sensor cycle for testing


Listen for normal sounds during startup and operation


5. Check for Error Codes


Note any error codes or blinking lights on the control panel


Consult your owner's manual for their meaning


Clear the code if instructed and monitor if it returns


Regular dryer maintenance service can prevent many common problems and extend the life of your GE appliance.
When to Call for Professional GE Dryer Repair
Consider professional GE dryer repair service when:


Heating problems persist after basic troubleshooting


The dryer won't start or stops mid-cycle repeatedly


Unusual noises continue or worsen


Error codes persist or return after resetting


Burning smells or smoke occur during operation


Gas odors are present (for gas models)


The dryer trips circuit breakers repeatedly


Professional dryer repair becomes particularly important for:
Heating System Issues: Whether electric or gas, heating components require specialized knowledge and tools for both effective repair and safety compliance.
Control System Problems: GE's electronic control systems often require specific diagnostic equipment and technical expertise.
Gas System Repairs: Gas dryer components demand expert attention for both effective repair and compliance with safety standards.
If your GE dryer shows signs of serious malfunction, professional diagnosis will identify the underlying cause and restore optimal function.

full_content.content: "My GE refrigerator isn't cooling properly" is the most urgent concern we hear from homeowners. Temperature problems typically stem from several key areas:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Condenser Coil Problems: Located either behind the refrigerator or underneath behind the toe kick grille, these coils release heat from inside your unit. When coated with dust, pet hair, or kitchen grease, cooling efficiency plummets. In severe cases, the refrigerator cannot maintain proper temperature regardless of settings.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Evaporator Fan Malfunctions: This critical component circulates cold air throughout the refrigerator compartment. Located behind the freezer panel in most GE models, problems range from ice accumulation blocking movement to motor failures causing inadequate airflow.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Compressor Issues: As the heart of your cooling system, compressor problems announce themselves through distinctive sounds or cooling failures. Clicking, buzzing, or silence when the compressor should be running usually indicates start relay issues, overload protector failures, or compressor motor problems.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Electronic Control Board Failures: GE refrigerators rely on sophisticated control systems to manage temperatures, defrost cycles, and features. When these electronic components malfunction, they can cause erratic temperature fluctuations or complete cooling failure.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: If your refrigerator shows signs of temperature control problems, schedule GE refrigerator repair. Our technicians can identify the specific cause and restore proper cooling function.

full_content.content: Try These Steps Before Calling for GE Refrigerator Repair
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: Before scheduling professional refrigerator repair service, several troubleshooting steps might resolve minor issues:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content:
Check Power and Settings


Ensure the unit is properly plugged in with no tripped breakers


Verify temperature controls are set correctly (typically 37°F for refrigerator, 0°F for freezer)


For models with digital displays, check for error codes or demo mode settings




Examine Condenser Coils


Locate coils on the back or underneath the refrigerator


If accessible and visibly dusty, gently vacuum with a soft brush attachment


Ensure adequate clearance around the refrigerator (at least 1 inch on all sides)




Inspect Door Seals


Check gaskets for food debris, damage, or misalignment


Clean seals with mild soap and water if necessary


Test sealing by closing the door on a dollar bill—it should hold firmly with slight resistance when pulled




Clear Vents and Check Airflow


Ensure internal vents aren't blocked by food items


Check that the air damper between compartments isn't stuck (in side-by-side models)


Make sure nothing is blocking the external coil ventilation




Reset Electronic Controls


For GE models with electronic displays, try resetting the control system


Disconnect power for 30-60 seconds, then reconnect


Allow 24 hours for temperatures to fully stabilize after reset
full_content.attributes: {"class":"list-decimal pl-4 lg:pl-7 text-left text-gray-500 text-md leading-6 mb-4","node":"[object Object]"}

full_content.content: Professional repair becomes particularly important for:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Sealed System Issues: Problems involving refrigerant require EPA certification and specialized tools for proper diagnosis and repair.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Electronic Control Repairs: Modern GE refrigerators feature sophisticated control boards that require specific diagnostic equipment.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Compressor Problems: The heart of your cooling system demands expert diagnosis to determine whether repair or replacement is needed.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: If your refrigerator displays persistent cooling problems, it's time to schedule professional GE appliance repair service to diagnose and resolve the underlying issue.

full_content.content: Common GE Washer Issues We Repair
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Is your GE washer refusing to turn on or start? Try these DIY troubleshooting steps to get it running again, from checking the power cord to inspecting the control board. If DIY solutions aren't enough, we'll also advise you on when it's time to call a professional.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: When your washer won’t turn on, you may be able to fix the problem yourself using some basic troubleshooting steps. When you’re unable to find and fix the cause of the failure yourself, schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and repair your washer.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and repair your washer
full_content.attributes: {"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and repair your washer","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/repair/washer-repair-service"}

full_content.content: Troubleshooting: Why Is My GE Washing Machine Not Turning On?
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Troubleshooting: Why Is My GE Washing Machine Not Turning On?

full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: See if the power cord is fully plugged into the electrical outlet for the washer. If not, plug in the power cord fully and check the washer for power.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Examine the power cord for damage. Unplug the power cord and replace it if it’s damaged.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: If you’re unable to replace the power cord yourself, have a service technician replace the power cord.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: have a service technician replace the power cord
full_content.attributes: {"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"have a service technician replace the power cord","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/repair/washer-repair-service"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: If you found no problems with the power cord, check the house circuit breaker for the washer’s electrical outlet. Reset the house circuit breaker and see if the washer powers up. This may fix the washer problem.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: To test whether the electrical outlet is the problem, plug a hair dryer or other electrical device into it. If the hair dryer doesn't work, the wiring in the outlet is the problem. Have an electrician repair the electrical outlet.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: When you have a top-load washer, a broken lid switch may prevent the washer from starting.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Unplug the washer and check the lid switch for damage. If the lid switch is damaged, replace it.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Here’s a DIY video that shows how to replace the lid switch in a common washing machine:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Replacing a broken lid switch may fix your washer problem.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: 5. Examine Wiring Connections on the Control Board
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content:
When your washer has an electronic control instead of a timer dial, loose power cord wiring connections on the control board could be preventing your washer from powering up.
If you’re confident in your ability so safely access the control board in your washer, unplug the machine and check the power cord wires connected to the electronic control board. Reconnect any loose wires.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Reconnecting loose wires may fix your washing machine.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

{"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"fix your washing machine","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/blog/is-your-top-load-washing-machine-making-noise-guide"}

full_content.content: 6. Check the Electronic Control Board for Damage
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: Examine the electronic board for burn marks. Burnt spots on the circuit board indicate that internal components or wires shorted out on the control board.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Replace the electronic control board when you find damage.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Follow the steps in our How to replace the machine control board in a front-load washer repair guide to install a new circuit board in a front-load washer.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: How to replace the machine control board in a front-load washer repair guide
Here’s a DIY repair video that shows how to replace the electronic control board in a common top-load washing machine:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

{"width":"660","height":"371","src":"https://www.youtube.com/embed/X52jg_tmrao?enablejsapi=1&origin=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.searshomeservices.com","frameborder":"0","allow":"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture","allowfullscreen":"","data-gtm-yt-inspected-97481366_2057":"true","id":"147533787","title":"How to Replace the Electronic Control Board on a Kenmore Vertical Modular Washer (VMW)"}

full_content.content: Replacing a damaged electronic control board may fix your washer when it won’t power up.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: Loose wiring connections between the electronic control board and the control panel can prevent the washer from powering up.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Unplug the washer from the electrical outlet if it isn’t already unplugged and check the wiring connections between the main electronic control board and the control panel. Reconnect any loose wires. This may fix the washer problem.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: A damaged control panel can also prevent the washer from powering up. Replace the control panel if it’s damaged.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: 8. Have a Service Technician Fix the Washer
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: Complicated washer problems can be difficult to diagnose and repair on your own. When all else fails, schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and fix the washer.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and fix the washer
full_content.attributes: {"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and fix the washer","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/repair/washer-repair-service"}

full_content.content: The repair technician will conduct advanced tests to determine the cause of the washer problem and repair the washer.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Common Causes for More GE Washing Machine Issues
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Washers all have some common components such as water valves, drive motors and drain pumps. Because many washing machine components are similar, they can encounter similar part failures.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Here are some of the most common GE washer failures.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: Control knobs are some of the first components to fail in washers. You use the washer control knobs to set each cycle so they often wear out faster than other components.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: You can typically replace broken washer knobs yourself. Order replacement knobs from our Sears PartsDirect website.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Most control knobs just push onto the stem on the control panel. Some knobs are threaded onto the stem. Timer control knobs are sometimes more complicated to replace. To replace some timer knobs, you need to unplug the washer and pry out the timer knob shaft from the back of the timer to release the control knob locking tab and remove the timer knob. Is your Whirlpool washer start button not working?
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Whirlpool washer start button not working
full_content.attributes: {"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"","target":"_self","title":"Whirlpool washer start button not working","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/symptom/whirlpool-washer-won-t-start-cycle"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: The washer start switch is another component that you use constantly on your washer. It can also wear out quicker than other components. When you push the start button but the washer won’t start, you may need to replace the start button.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: If you’re unsure whether the start button is bad, have a service technician examine and repair your washing machine.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: Overloading the washer is a common mistake that users make and overloading causes the washer motor to wear out faster. Keep your washer motor lasting longer by following the laundry loading instructions in your owner’s manual. Is your Whirlpool washer not turning on?
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

{"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"","target":"_self","title":"Whirlpool Washer not turning on","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/symptom/whirlpool-washer-not-turning-on"}

full_content.content: When you washer motor does go bad, have a service technician replace it.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl font-semibold font-oswald leading-5 text-blue-300 my-3"}

full_content.content: The main electronic control board, also called the mother board, governs the timing and execution of the washer component functions. It controls the fill valves, the drive motor and the drain pump.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Because it’s connected to so many washer components through wiring, the main control board can experience an electrical short circuit at any time. You’ll usually see burnt wiring connected to the control board or a burn spot on the control board circuitry when it experiences an electrical short.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Replace the main electronic control board when it shorts out. Also check the circuit connected to the control board or have a service technician check the circuits before you install the new main control board so the new board doesn’t short out again as soon as you power up the washer.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Common GE Dryer Problems and Their Causes
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: When your GE dryer stops heating, makes unusual noises, or fails to start altogether, laundry day quickly transforms from a routine task into a frustrating ordeal. Wet clothes piling up and disrupted household schedules aren't just inconveniences—they're genuine problems that demand prompt, expert attention.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: At Sears Home Services, we understand both the technical complexities of GE dryers and the urgency you feel when these essential appliances malfunction. Our factory-trained technicians bring specialized expertise to diagnose and repair every model in the GE lineup, from basic units to sophisticated models with advanced sensor drying technology and smart features.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Understanding How Your GE Dryer Works
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: GE dryers combine precision engineering with innovative features designed for reliable performance. At their core, these appliances operate through a coordinated system of heating elements or gas burners, motors, airflow components, and electronic controls.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: In electric GE dryers, heating coils convert electrical energy into heat, while gas models use a burner assembly with ignition components to create heat. Both types rely on a motor-driven drum that tumbles clothes while a blower fan circulates heated air through the tumbling garments and then out through the exhaust system.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Many GE dryers feature sophisticated moisture-sensing technology that monitors humidity levels inside the drum and automatically adjusts drying time accordingly. This system uses sensor bars inside the drum that detect moisture levels as clothes tumble against them, communicating this information to the control board.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: The control panel, whether using traditional knobs or digital displays, interfaces with an electronic control board that serves as the dryer's command center. This sophisticated component processes information from various sensors and manages all functions from temperature regulation to cycle timing.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Understanding these specialized components helps explain why GE dryers require technical expertise for proper diagnosis and repair. When problems arise, identifying which part of this interconnected system has malfunctioned is crucial for effective solutions.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Common GE Dryer Problems and Their Causes
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: "My GE dryer runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Electric Heating Element Failures: The heating coil may have burned out or developed breaks in the element. When functioning correctly, this component should glow red when active and show consistent electrical resistance when tested.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Gas Ignition Problems: In gas models, the igniter may fail to glow properly, or flame sensor issues might prevent the gas valve from opening. You might hear the igniter clicking without the burner igniting, indicating a specific component in the ignition sequence has failed.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Thermostat and Thermal Fuse Failures: GE dryers use multiple temperature-sensing devices as safety features. When these components fail or trip due to overheating, they can prevent the heating system from operating while allowing the drum to continue rotating.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Airflow Restrictions: Even with functioning heating components, restricted airflow from lint buildup in the exhaust system, clogged lint screen, or internal ductwork blockages can trigger safety features that disable heating or significantly reduce drying efficiency.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: If your GE dryer isn't producing adequate heat, our clothes dryer repair technicians can diagnose and resolve these heating system problems safely and effectively.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Several mechanical problems can affect GE dryer performance:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Drum Not Turning: May indicate drive belt failures, motor issues, or broken drum support rollers. You might hear the motor running without drum movement, suggesting a broken or slipped belt.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Start Problems: Failure to start can stem from door switch malfunctions, broken start switches, control board issues, or power supply problems. Often, no response when pressing the start button indicates electrical control issues rather than mechanical failures.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Premature Stopping: Dryers that stop before clothes are dry might have cycling thermostat failures, moisture sensor problems, or electronic control issues. This can manifest as short cycles or sudden shutdowns mid-cycle.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Noisy Operation: Unusual sounds often indicate worn drum support rollers, idler pulleys, or motor bearings that require replacement. Different noises point to specific components—squeaking often indicates roller issues, while rumbling might suggest drum support problems.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: When your GE dryer experiences mechanical failures, our GE dryer repair technicians can quickly identify the cause and implement the appropriate repair.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

{"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"GE dryer repair","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/repair/ge"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Modern GE dryers display specific codes to help identify problems:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: E1 Codes: Typically indicate thermistor or temperature sensing failures that affect heating control
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: E2 Codes: Usually signal user interface or button circuit issues that affect cycle selection
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: E3 Codes: Often relate to moisture sensor problems that impact automatic cycle termination
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: E4/E5 Codes: Generally indicate main control board communication or memory failures
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: E6 Codes: Frequently point to motor or drive system electrical problems
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: For persistent error codes or electronic malfunctions, professional diagnosis ensures the correct component is identified and replaced.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Proper airflow is critical for GE dryer operation, with several common issues affecting performance:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Lint Screen Blockages: Even partially clogged lint screens can significantly reduce airflow and extend drying times.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Vent Line Restrictions: Crushed, kinked, or lint-clogged vent lines prevent proper air and moisture evacuation, causing extended drying times and potential overheating.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: External Vent Hood Obstructions: Lint accumulation, bird nests, or damaged vent covers can restrict exhaust airflow, affecting performance and creating safety hazards.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Internal Duct Blockages: Lint can accumulate in the dryer's internal ductwork, particularly near the blower fan or transition hose, restricting airflow even when external venting appears clear.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: These airflow issues not only affect performance but create potential fire hazards when not addressed. Regular dryer duct cleaning is essential for both efficiency and safety.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Try These Steps Before Calling for GE Dryer Repair
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: Before scheduling professional dryer repair service, several troubleshooting steps might resolve minor issues:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content:
Verify the dryer is properly plugged in


Ensure the circuit breaker hasn't tripped (electric models)


Check that the gas supply valve is fully open (gas models)


Test the outlet with another device to confirm power is available
full_content.attributes: {"class":"list-disc font-normal text-left text-gray-500 text-md leading-6 pl-12 sm:pl-14","node":"[object Object]"}

full_content.content: Verify the dryer is properly plugged in
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-md leading-6 font-montserrat text-left text-gray-500 my-2 first:mt-0 ","node":"[object Object]"}

full_content.content: Verify the dryer is properly plugged in
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Ensure the circuit breaker hasn't tripped (electric models)
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-md leading-6 font-montserrat text-left text-gray-500 my-2 first:mt-0 ","node":"[object Object]"}

full_content.content: Ensure the circuit breaker hasn't tripped (electric models)
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Check that the gas supply valve is fully open (gas models)
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-md leading-6 font-montserrat text-left text-gray-500 my-2 first:mt-0 ","node":"[object Object]"}

full_content.content: Check that the gas supply valve is fully open (gas models)
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Test the outlet with another device to confirm power is available

full_content.content: Glossary TermsWhat is the drum of the washing machine?The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.What is a 608 Certification?The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.What is a Condenser?A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.

self.__next_f.push([1,"When your GE appliances need professional attention, Sears Home Services offers reliable GE repair service to ensure your appliances are restored to peak performance. With trained technicians who specialize in GE products, you can trust their expertise to handle everything from dishwashers to refrigerators.

## GE Appliances We Service

We specialize in repairing major GE home appliances, including:

* **Refrigerators:** Addressing issues like cooling problems, leaks, and unusual noises.
* **Washers and Dryers:** Fixing problems such as spinning issues, water drainage, and heating malfunctions.
* **Ovens and Ranges:** Repairing temperature inconsistencies, ignition problems, and faulty burners.
* **Dishwashers:** Resolving issues like poor cleaning performance, water leaks, and drainage problems.
* **Microwaves:** Handling problems such as non-heating, turntable issues, and display malfunctions.

## Why Choose Sears Home Services

* __Certified Technicians:__ Our team is trained to handle repairs for all major GE appliance models.
* __Prompt Service:__ We offer same-day and next-day appointments to get your appliances back in working order quickly.
* __Satisfaction Guarantee:__ All our [appliance repairs](/repair) come with a satisfaction guarantee.
* __Comprehensive Coverage:__ We serve customers nationwide, ensuring expert GE appliance repair services are available in your area."])

self.__next_f.push([1,"For more than 100 years, GE gas electrified and modernized life, bringing convenience and fun to kitchens and homes. In addition to making the most innovative appliances, GE is committed to serving their owners, customers and communities.

With uncompromising attention to every detail, customizable hardware, matte and sleek glass finishes, GE offers distinct appliances to match your style and tastes. GE appliances truly elevate everything in luxury kitchens. GE’s appliance offering features rich materials and precise design, are crafted with style that endures. 

Outstanding GE products are extremely reliable and rarely break down, but parts may eventually wear out. Should you encounter a failure that requires a GE service request, trust Sears Home Services to have technicians in your area to make the repair and Sears PartsDirect to have the parts you need to get your GE appliance back into top shape.

### Sears Home Services Repairs GE Appliances No Matter Where You Bought Them!

It doesn’t matter where you bought your washer GE appliance. If it breaks, then Sears Home Services will send our certified GE appliance repair technicians to your home to repair and maintain your products.

Our GE appliance repair service is the best in the nation. Our technicians are factory-trained to perform General Electric service for all types of appliances including washers, dryers, refrigerators, dishwashers and ranges. 

### Sears Home Services Conducts Thousands of Brand Name Repairs Each Month!

Even dependable appliances break, wear out, need maintenance or require the occasional repair. Should your GE appliance require a repair, you can trust the expert technicians at Sears Home Services to quickly fix the problem.

When your GE appliances need expert attention, Sears Home Services offers professional GE service to ensure your home appliances run smoothly. With a team of skilled technicians, Sears is equipped to handle all types of *GE appliance repair near me* requests, from refrigerators to washers and dryers. 

Our GE appliance service includes thorough diagnostics and repairs, using genuine parts to ensure lasting results. For those searching for *GE appliances near me* that require maintenance or repair, Sears Home Services provides reliable and convenient solutions, making it easy to keep your GE appliances in top condition.

### Should Your GE Appliance Require Service, You Can Rely On Sears Home Services!

Our expert GE technicians will diagnose the problem with your appliance, carefully explain the issue, and conduct the repair.

When your GE appliances need professional care, Sears Home Services is a trusted option when looking for *GE repair service near me*. As a GE authorized appliance repair provider, Sears ensures that your appliances receive high-quality service using genuine parts and expert knowledge. If you're searching for *GE appliances near me* and you need repair or maintenance, Sears offers convenient scheduling and reliable service to keep your appliances running smoothly. When searching for a skilled “GE repairman near me,” you can trust that your GE appliances are in capable hands, getting the attention they need to perform at their best.

## Do You Need to Have Your GE Appliance Repaired or Maintained?

Trust Sears Home Services for fast, reliable service! Schedule your appointment with Sears Home Services for a time that works best for you! You can select:

-   [Dryer repair](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/dryer-repair-service)

-   [Washer repair](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/washer-repair-service)

-   [Refrigerator repair](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/refrigerator-repair-service)

-   [Dishwasher repair](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/dishwasher-repair-service)

-   [Oven repair](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/oven-repair-service)

-   [Range repair](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/range-repair-service)

-   [Cooktop repair](https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/cooktop-repair-service)

 Don’t see what you’re looking for? [Contact Sears Home Service](https://www.searshomeservices.com/contact) to speak with a representative who can direct you to the right service offerings.

 ![GE-refrigerator-repair service](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/5KFeLgh503FpxehLYoVE8M/904efb530fbbeec9b50f47d5b5132944/GE-refrigerator-service.png)

## Common GE Refrigerator Problems and Their Causes 

### Temperature Control Issues 

"My GE refrigerator isn't cooling properly" is the most urgent concern we hear from homeowners. Temperature problems typically stem from several key areas: 

**Condenser Coil Problems**: Located either behind the refrigerator or underneath behind the toe kick grille, these coils release heat from inside your unit. When coated with dust, pet hair, or kitchen grease, cooling efficiency plummets. In severe cases, the refrigerator cannot maintain proper temperature regardless of settings. 

**Evaporator Fan Malfunctions**: This critical component circulates cold air throughout the refrigerator compartment. Located behind the freezer panel in most GE models, problems range from ice accumulation blocking movement to motor failures causing inadequate airflow. 

**Compressor Issues**: As the heart of your cooling system, compressor problems announce themselves through distinctive sounds or cooling failures. Clicking, buzzing, or silence when the compressor should be running usually indicates start relay issues, overload protector failures, or compressor motor problems. 

**Electronic Control Board Failures**: GE refrigerators rely on sophisticated control systems to manage temperatures, defrost cycles, and features. When these electronic components malfunction, they can cause erratic temperature fluctuations or complete cooling failure. 

If your refrigerator shows signs of temperature control problems, schedule [GE refrigerator repair](/repair). Our technicians can identify the specific cause and restore proper cooling function. 

### Ice Maker and Water Dispenser Problems 

GE refrigerator owners frequently contact us about these convenience features: 

**Ice Maker Failures** commonly involve: 

- Water supply issues (insufficient pressure or clogged water lines) 

- Frozen fill tubes preventing water from reaching the ice maker 

- Failed water inlet valves not allowing water flow 

- Ice maker module malfunctions 

- Faulty electronic controls 

**Water Dispenser Issues** typically stem from: 

- Water filter clogs reducing flow 

- Frozen water lines inside the door or refrigerator walls 

- Dispenser control board failures 

- Broken dispenser mechanisms 

- Faulty water inlet valves 

When your GE refrigerator's ice maker stops working, set up [fridge repair service](/repair/refrigerator-repair-service). Our technicians will diagnose and repair these specialized systems. 

### Unusual Noises 

Different sounds from your GE refrigerator often indicate specific problems: 

**Buzzing or Humming**: Often related to the compressor or fans operating under stress, or water filling the ice maker 

**Clicking**: Typically suggests start relay problems or compressor attempting to start but failing 

**Rattling or Vibrating**: Usually indicates loose components or improper leveling affecting normal operation 

**Gurgling or Sizzling**: Often normal refrigerant flow sounds, but excessive noise may signal refrigerant system issues 

Understanding these sound patterns helps identify the underlying issue. If you're experiencing unusual noises from your refrigerator, schedule [appliance repair](/repair). Our technicians can pinpoint the cause and restore quiet operation. 

### Water Leaks and Frost Buildup 

Water problems and excessive frost indicate specific malfunctions: 

**Water Leaks** typically originate from: 

- Clogged defrost drain tubes allowing condensation to overflow 

- Water supply line leaks at connections or due to damage 

- Drain pan cracks or improper positioning 

- Water filter housing leaks 

- Condensation due to door seal problems 

**Frost Buildup** commonly results from: 

- Defrost system failures (heater, timer, or thermistor) 

- Door gasket air leaks allowing warm, humid air to enter 

- Damaged or improperly closing doors 

- Electronic control issues affecting defrost cycles 

When you notice water leaking from your refrigerator or excessive frost accumulation, prompt professional attention can prevent water damage and more extensive appliance repairs. 

## Try These Steps Before Calling for GE Refrigerator Repair 

Before scheduling professional [refrigerator repair](/repair/refrigerator-repair-service) service, several troubleshooting steps might resolve minor issues: 

1. **Check Power and Settings** 

   - Ensure the unit is properly plugged in with no tripped breakers 

   - Verify temperature controls are set correctly (typically 37°F for refrigerator, 0°F for freezer) 

   - For models with digital displays, check for error codes or demo mode settings 

2. **Examine Condenser Coils** 

   - Locate coils on the back or underneath the refrigerator 

   - If accessible and visibly dusty, gently vacuum with a soft brush attachment 

   - Ensure adequate clearance around the refrigerator (at least 1 inch on all sides) 

3. **Inspect Door Seals** 

   - Check gaskets for food debris, damage, or misalignment 

   - Clean seals with mild soap and water if necessary 

   - Test sealing by closing the door on a dollar bill—it should hold firmly with slight resistance when pulled 

4. **Clear Vents and Check Airflow** 

   - Ensure internal vents aren't blocked by food items 

   - Check that the air damper between compartments isn't stuck (in side-by-side models) 

   - Make sure nothing is blocking the external coil ventilation 

5. **Reset Electronic Controls** 

   - For GE models with electronic displays, try resetting the control system 

   - Disconnect power for 30-60 seconds, then reconnect 

   - Allow 24 hours for temperatures to fully stabilize after reset 

If you found that the condenser coils are dirty, you can clean them using the steps shown in this DIY video:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/SwA5dMW9bhg" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Regular [appliance maintenance](/maintain/appliance-maintenance) can prevent many common problems, but some issues require expert attention to resolve properly. 

## When to Call for Professional GE Refrigerator Repair 

Consider professional service when: 

- Temperature problems persist after basic troubleshooting 

- Water is leaking onto your floor 

- Unusual noises continue or worsen 

- Ice maker or water dispenser malfunctions continue 

- Frost builds up despite defrosting 

- Food spoilage occurs due to temperature fluctuations 

Professional repair becomes particularly important for: 

**Sealed System Issues**: Problems involving refrigerant require EPA certification and specialized tools for proper diagnosis and repair. 

**Electronic Control Repairs**: Modern GE refrigerators feature sophisticated control boards that require specific diagnostic equipment. 

**Compressor Problems**: The heart of your cooling system demands expert diagnosis to determine whether repair or replacement is needed. 

If your refrigerator displays persistent cooling problems, it's time to schedule professional [GE appliance repair](/repair) service to diagnose and resolve the underlying issue.

## Common GE Washer Issues We Repair

### Washing machine won’t start

Is your GE washer refusing to turn on or start? Try these DIY troubleshooting steps to get it running again, from checking the power cord to inspecting the control board. If DIY solutions aren't enough, we'll also advise you on when it's time to call a professional.

When your washer won’t turn on, you may be able to fix the problem yourself using some basic troubleshooting steps. When you’re unable to find and fix the cause of the failure yourself, [schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and repair your washer](/repair/washer-repair-service).

**Troubleshooting: Why Is My GE Washing Machine Not Turning On?**

#### 1. Check the Power Cord

See if the power cord is fully plugged into the electrical outlet for the washer. If not, plug in the power cord fully and check the washer for power.

Examine the power cord for damage. Unplug the power cord and replace it if it’s damaged.

If you’re unable to replace the power cord yourself, [have a service technician replace the power cord](/repair/washer-repair-service).

#### 2. Reset the House Circuit Breaker

If you found no problems with the power cord, check the house circuit breaker for the washer’s electrical outlet. Reset the house circuit breaker and see if the washer powers up. This may fix the washer problem.

#### 3. Test the Electrical Outlet

To test whether the electrical outlet is the problem, plug a hair dryer or other electrical device into it. If the hair dryer doesn't work, the wiring in the outlet is the problem. Have an electrician repair the electrical outlet.

#### 4. Check the Lid Switch

When you have a top-load washer, a broken lid switch may prevent the washer from starting. 

Unplug the washer and check the lid switch for damage. If the lid switch is damaged, replace it.

Here’s a DIY video that shows how to replace the lid switch in a common washing machine:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/s14hSB9nvSs" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Replacing a broken lid switch may fix your washer problem.

#### 5. Examine Wiring Connections on the Control Board

When your washer has an electronic control instead of a timer dial, loose power cord wiring connections on the control board could be preventing your washer from powering up.
If you’re confident in your ability so safely access the control board in your washer, unplug the machine and check the power cord wires connected to the electronic control board. Reconnect any loose wires.

Reconnecting loose wires may [fix your washing machine](/blog/is-your-top-load-washing-machine-making-noise-guide).

#### 6. Check the Electronic Control Board for Damage

Examine the electronic board for burn marks. Burnt spots on the circuit board indicate that internal components or wires shorted out on the control board. 

Replace the electronic control board when you find damage.

Follow the steps in our [How to replace the machine control board in a front-load washer repair guide](https://www.searspartsdirect.com/diy/repair-guide/how-to-replace-the-machine-control-board-in-a-front-load-washer) to install a new circuit board in a front-load washer.

Here’s a DIY repair video that shows how to replace the electronic control board in a common top-load washing machine: 

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/X52jg_tmrao" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Replacing a damaged electronic control board may fix your washer when it won’t power up.

#### 7. Inspect the Control Panel

Loose wiring connections between the electronic control board and the control panel can prevent the washer from powering up. 

Unplug the washer from the electrical outlet if it isn’t already unplugged and check the wiring connections between the main electronic control board and the control panel. Reconnect any loose wires. This may fix the washer problem.

A damaged control panel can also prevent the washer from powering up. Replace the control panel if it’s damaged.

#### 8. Have a Service Technician Fix the Washer

Complicated washer problems can be difficult to diagnose and repair on your own. When all else fails, [schedule a Sears Technician to diagnose and fix the washer](/repair/washer-repair-service). 

The repair technician will conduct advanced tests to determine the cause of the washer problem and repair the washer.

### Common Causes for More GE Washing Machine Issues

Washers all have some common components such as water valves, drive motors and drain pumps. Because many washing machine components are similar, they can encounter similar part failures.

Here are some of the most common GE washer failures.

#### Broken Knobs

Control knobs are some of the first components to fail in washers. You use the washer control knobs to set each cycle so they often wear out faster than other components.

You can typically replace broken washer knobs yourself. Order replacement knobs from our [Sears PartsDirect](https://www.searspartsdirect.com/) website.

Most control knobs just push onto the stem on the control panel. Some knobs are threaded onto the stem. Timer control knobs are sometimes more complicated to replace. To replace some timer knobs, you need to unplug the washer and pry out the timer knob shaft from the back of the timer to release the control knob locking tab and remove the timer knob. Is your [Whirlpool washer start button not working](https://www.searshomeservices.com/symptom/whirlpool-washer-won-t-start-cycle "Whirlpool washer start button not working")?

#### Faulty Start Switch

The washer start switch is another component that you use constantly on your washer. It can also wear out quicker than other components. When you push the start button but the washer won’t start, you may need to replace the start button.

If you’re unsure whether the start button is bad, have a service technician examine and repair your washing machine.

#### Broken Washer Motor

Overloading the washer is a common mistake that users make and overloading causes the washer motor to wear out faster. Keep your washer motor lasting longer by following the laundry loading instructions in your owner’s manual. Is your [Whirlpool washer not turning on](https://www.searshomeservices.com/symptom/whirlpool-washer-not-turning-on "Whirlpool Washer not turning on")?

When you washer motor does go bad, have a service technician replace it.

#### Shorted Main Control Board

The main electronic control board, also called the mother board, governs the timing and execution of the washer component functions. It controls the fill valves, the drive motor and the drain pump.

Because it’s connected to so many washer components through wiring, the main control board can experience an electrical short circuit at any time. You’ll usually see burnt wiring connected to the control board or a burn spot on the control board circuitry when it experiences an electrical short.

Replace the main electronic control board when it shorts out. Also check the circuit connected to the control board or have a service technician check the circuits before you install the new main control board so the new board doesn’t short out again as soon as you power up the washer.
